title: More UX/UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user finished on-boarding

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to More tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* TV icon (iOS only)
* Settings
* Stats (when the user selected a favorite team)
* Player Search 
* Gameday Audio
* MiLB.com Podcast
* MiLBStore.com
* MiLB Auctions
* Ben's Biz Blog (iOS only)
* Prospect Watch
* Playball.org
* First Pitch FAQ
* Subscription Management
* Contact Us
* About MiLB.com
* Blackout Restrictions
* Privacy Policy
* Terms and Conditions
* MLB At Bat
* MLB Ballpark

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user navigates to More tab
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the navigation bar complete and neat (no typographical errors, no overlapping and/or missing icons/texts)

THEN the wait time for the page to load will not be longer than 5 secs

THEN the user will be able to scroll through the page smoothly 

THEN the user will be able to pinch in/out of the web views

THEN the users will be able to click on buttons/elements and these will work

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an item
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page associated to that item

title: TV Icon (iOS only)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to More Page
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on TV icon
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Class picker
* Date (Day Month Date)
* Arrows to navigate through the date (next/previous date)
* Video list (if available depending on the selected date)
* Done button

title: Notifications (same to the one in On-Boarding)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be able to configure the notifications

THEN the app will push notifications depending on the user's preferences

title: Create a MiLB Account (Webview)
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user tapped on 'Create a MiLB.com Account'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the MiLB.com Register form

title: About First Pitch
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on "About First Pitch"
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the About First Pitch page containing the following: 

For iOS:
* Application Version
* Carrier 
* Device
* ID5
* iOS Version
* Model
* Build Number
* Config Environment 
* Email Logs button

For Android:
* Build Number
* Config Environment

title: Favorite Teams (same to the one in On-Boarding)
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the user will be able to select favorite teams

THEN the app will save the user's preferences

title: Settings UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Settings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Log in to MiLB.com Account button
* Create a MiLB Account button
* Set Home Screen Icon
* Notifications
* Favorite Teams
* About First Pitch

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on an item
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the correct page associated to that item

title: Set Home Screen Icon
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings

GIVEN that the user tapped on "Set Home Screen Icon"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user scrolls through
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the correct team names and team logos

THEN the app will display all of the teams alphabetically in the 'All Teams' section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has favorite teams selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Favorite Teams' section will be filled by user's selected favorite teams

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user has no favorite teams selected
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the 'Favorite Teams' section will be empty (no teams listed)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on a team from either 'Favorite Teams' or 'All Teams' section
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will set the home screen icon to that team's icon

THEN the app will display the "You have changed the icon for 'First Pitch'" modal with the icon of the team selected

THEN the icon and team name in 'Current Icon' section will change (to the team the user has selected)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Reset"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will revert the icon to First Pitch's icon

THEN the app will display the "You have changed the icon for 'First Pitch'" modal with the app's default icon

title: No Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has no account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* 'Log in to MiLB.com Account' button
* 'Create a MiLB Account' button
* Preferences section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log in to MiLB.com Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the 'Log In With Your MiLB Account' form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Create a MiLB Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the webview for registration for MiLB.com account

title: An Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has an account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* User's email address
* "Logged into MiLB Account" text under it
* Preferences section
* Sign Out button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Sign Out"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the iOS modal "Are you sure you want to sign out?"

THEN the app will display "Sign Out" button

THEN the app will display "Cancel" button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Sign Out"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will sign out the user

THEN the app will display the modal

THEN the User Account section of the Settings will be updated (no signed in account scenario)

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Cancel"
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will dismiss the modal and the buttons

THEN the app will not sign out the user

title: 'Log In With Your MiLB Account' Form
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log In With Your MiLB Account' button
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the 'Log In With Your MiLB Account' form with the following:

* Username field
* Password field
* Login button
* 'Privacy Policy' link button
* 'Forgot Password' link button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the username filed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the username in this field 

THEN the field will display the username typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the password filed
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to type in the password in this field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types the next character of the password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will hide the recently typed character by using ●

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with valid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will collapse the form

THEN the app will update the User Account section of the Settings page

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with invalid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display an error message: "Invalid Username/Password"

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Privacy Policy'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the Privacy Policy page

THEN the app will not use a third-party app to display this

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Done'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will collapse the Privacy Policy window

THEN the app will bring back the user to the 'Log In With Your MiLB Account' Form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Forgot Password'
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Send Password Form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the email filed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the email in this field 

THEN the field will display the email typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Submit" button with a valid email address in the email field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display a confirmation message: "New Password Sent"

THEN the user will receive an email in the email address provided

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on "Submit" button with an invalid email address in the email field

WHEN the user taps on "Submit" button with an invalid input in the field (e.g. random texts that are not an email)
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display an error message: "Invalid Email Address"

THEN the user will not receive an email in the email address provided

title: Settings UI
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab
custom_steps: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Log In to MiLB.com button
* Notifications
* About First Pitch
* Select Favorite Teams
* Reset Your MiLB.com Password
* Create a MiLB.com Account

title: Reset Your MiLB.com Password
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the user navigated to Settings

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Reset your MiLB.com password'
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following: 

* Reset the password to your MiLB.com account
* Email field
* 'Send Reset Request' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the username filed
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the username in this field

THEN the field will display the username typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content:
WHEN the user taps on 'Send Reset Request' button with valid email address in the field

WHEN the user taps on 'Send Reset Request' button with invalid email address in the field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the Settings page

title: No Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has no account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* Log In to MiLB.com button
* Preferences section

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log In to MiLB.com' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display the 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' form

title: An Account Logged In
custom_preconds:
GIVEN that the user navigated to More tab

GIVEN that the user has an account logged in

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on Settings
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display the following:

* 'Logged into MiLB.com'
* Preferences section
* 'Log Out' button

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on 'Log Out' button
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the User Account section of the Settings will be updated (no signed in account scenario)

title: 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' Form
custom_preconds: GIVEN that the app displayed the 'Log In With Your MiLB.com Account' Form

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the username field
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the user will be able to type in the username in this field

THEN the field will display the username typed by the user

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on the password field
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the user will be able to type in the password in this field

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user types the next character of the password
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will hide the recently typed character by using ●

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with valid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected:
THEN the app will display 'Logged in to MiLB.com' at the top of Settings page

THEN the app will display 'Log out of MiLB.com' button at the bottom

custom_steps_separated.content: WHEN the user taps on "Login" button with invalid credentials on the username and password fields
custom_steps_separated.expected: THEN the app will display an error message: "Log in failed"
